policy: If credential stuffing is detected from a single IP, block immediately to prevent credential compromise.
If SSH brute-force attack is detected with more than 5 failures within 10 minutes, block the source IP immediately.
Monitor the source IP for escalation after detecting initial port scanning activity.
If multiple login attempts are made using unusual or non-existent usernames, investigate immediately, even if no login failures occur.
Monitor web login failures from single or multiple IPs unless the failure rate increases significantly.
If an incident is classified as INFO and no significant threat indicators are present, ignore the event to avoid unnecessary investigations.
